name: The Maxim Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights at the end of October and found the hotel rooms comfortable (recently renovated on the 3rd & 5th floors) and the bathrooms small but functional. The single rooms are basic but they are not overpriced, the double rooms were well kept.Air con in the rooms work well and a quiet night's sleep is possible. The location of the hotel is its strongest point - on the sea front with a taxi rank close by and car hire offices (Thrifty is next door) within minutes. Good restaurants and ATMs are close at hand too. The hotel is fairly pricey but not by Israeli standards. I did not feel ripped off!
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, very good location

reviews.text: The only criticisms are to be found in what I regard as a fairly basic breakfast - nothing cooked and no croissants/patiseries. Hotel service was abrupt, indeed non-existant. Don't expect help with luggage and if you want to store it on the last day, then fetch it yourself. Never a smile or a cheerful word, not even a thanks. Still, I live in Paris so this is not a novelty for me. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, just don't expect to be treated as a valued guest. You will love Israel.
reviews.title: Service spotty but great location and price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location by the beach and mass transit. The price would be high by US standards (130 night) and the rooms were small, but by Israeli standards and for the location, this was good; Israel is the second most expensive country I've visited, and I've been to 25 in my lifetime. The staff were mostly abrupt, one or two friendly. One warning; if you ask them about a paid tour, they'll be helpful. If you ask them questions re; traveling on your own, expect dishonesty; they'll tell you you can't get to places on your own and of course you can, by bus or train. They make money on the paid tours they steer you to, that is. Breakfast is cold but reliable. We stayed there about 10 out of 18 days of our trip and they were good about reservations. Do note; what you've heard about Israel is true; many people are very rude and this takes some getting used to; however, all the holy sights are easily visited and a great place to explore another culture (we also went to Jordan on this trip). Service was actually better than when we stayed in Jerusalem and Eilat. GIven the alternatives, we would stay again in this hotel. Note; we did have internet service in the room.
reviews.title: Great Location, clean .

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights. The location of the hotel couldn`t be better literally across the road from the beach. The reception very nice but the customer service is definately lacking, my cousin who is Israeli was wasitng for me while i checked in and even he commented on it. On another day i asked if they changed money the answer `No` ....not no we don`t but if you go around the corner etc just an abrubt `No` ....this isn`t typical of israelis in gerneral as some people might suggest .
reviews.title: best hotel in Tel Aviv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had whilst a bit tired looking was clean it had a TV with a variety of channels a kettle with tea and coffee , and most importantly the A/C worked.
reviews.title: Clean, small, friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, across the street from the beach and about halfway between Jaffa and the Tel Aviv port, easy walking distance to restaurants, sites, shopping, including Carmel Market, Sheinkin Street, Dizengoff, etc. Busses are one block away on Ben Yehuda.
reviews.title: Decent enough and good value

reviews.text: Rooms are cozy, but clean enough, and our 3rd floor room was set back from the street so that it was quite quiet. We had a booked a superior double "sea view" and if you strained to peek out of a small window, you might get a glimpse of the sea (not really). But no complaints.
reviews.title: clean, central, friendly staff and good breakfast
Great choice for Tel Aviv visit
reviews.text: Breakfast is good - salads, vegetables, fish, cheese, breads, etc. - and the staff was happy to make eggs on request. The afternoon cakes were a hit with my wife, too.

The staff quality is inconsistent and we found some of the desk staff to be rather abrupt and somewhat unhelpful. On the other hand, some gave us very useful instructions regarding busses and directions and made our journeys more successful. Shuly, the night guy was a gem.
reviews.title: Average hotel - good location

reviews.text: All in all, nothing too special, but entirely adequate.
reviews.title: Best location and good value for money

reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Well placed, unbeatable value for money

reviews.text: I stayed from 5th to 11th of August 2010. The room I booked was a Little Single for 99$/night. Note that this price is impossible to find at this period. The room was tiny but functional, very clean with a little bathroom. The bed was 90cm (only one person). I was first surprised by the small size of the room but finally my stay was rather good. The breakfast is included in the price and also the tea time at 5 p.m. every day. The staff was quiet polite and serviceable (except one fortunately not often present). Note that in the rooms 112/113 (and I suppose each floor) the wifi signal is not strong enough to have the internet connection. You have to go to the lobby.
reviews.title: Generally good

reviews.text: The location is close to the center of the city and next to the beach, The room was clean but quite small. The service looked a bit hasty (it looks like they made the bed in a hurry and so on) but there was no major problems. The air conditioner was loud and we had to turn it off while sleeping. The breakfast was plentiful and good. The wireless internet was not working for most of our stay.
reviews.title: Don t leave anything in your room !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were happy with our stay, despite the minor problems that we listed above.
reviews.title: Very good for the price.

reviews.text: We made our check out yesterday and few hours after, we called the reception to tell them that we forgot a shirt in the room. The receptionist told us that they would be surprised to find it back ...before checking the room. We had to call several times, and finally they told us that they founded nothing in the room. Check all your belongs if you are visiting this hotel. They might disappear rapidly
reviews.title: Check the room before checking in

reviews.text: service: good, friendly staff
reviews.title: a hotel in central and convenient location in telaviv

reviews.text: location: central, ideally located on the beachside
reviews.title: Close to Sea but no Sea View

reviews.text: rooms: nicely furnished, some of them with seaview, doubles and singles available
reviews.title: NIce location, good bargain.

reviews.text: breakfast: typical israeli style breakfast with various choice
reviews.title: Quite satisfactory

reviews.text: a very convenient location on the beachside in telaviv, convenient for walks to jaffa,the shopping area and 1 minute from the beach, very close to a choice of different restaurants and bars
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate

description: We offer you 71 fully air-conditioned and heated guest rooms, refurbished, private bath, hair dryer, direct dial telephone, cable TV, coffee shop, bar, Internet wireless access in all rooms. The Maxim Hotel is located in the Heart of Tel Aviv, the city of "24 Hours action" across the beach of the Mediterranean Sea. Restaurants, shopping centers and theaters are a few minutes from the Hotel. To Old Jaffa is 5 minutes by car or a 30 minute walk.
